description: Basic point-to-point movement with balanced costs.
example_command: Move from the starting point to (10, 5).

description: Prioritizes distance minimization over smoothness (sharp turns allowed).
example_command: Take the shortest possible route to the target.

description: Prioritizes minimizing jerk/snap for fluid motion.
example_command: Fly smoothly to the destination, avoid sudden movements.

description: Navigate around a known static obstacle.
example_command: Go to the goal but avoid the red circle in the center.

description: Passing through a narrow gap requiring high precision.
example_command: Carefully navigate through the narrow doorway.
Reach the target while keeping a safe distance from all walls.

description: Reaching a point with strict zero velocity/acceleration constraints.
example_command: Approach the charging station and come to a complete stop.
Cut the corner to reach the checkpoint quickly.

description: Visiting an intermediate point before the final goal.
example_command: Go to the goal via the supply depot at (5,5).

description: Oscillating path through a linear array of obstacles.
example_command: Weave through the pillars to reach the other side.

description: A long trajectory where energy (path length) is the only concern.
example_command: Travel to the far sector efficiently.

description: Start and End points are close, but facing opposite directions.
example_command: Perform a U-turn and return to the start line.

description: Contrary to standard logic, this path hugs the boundaries/walls.
example_command: Sneak along the wall to reach the exit.

meta_data.note: Negative obstacle weight implies attraction to obstacles (walls).

description: Starting with high initial velocity, no stopping at goal.
example_command: Pass through the checkpoint at high speed.

description: Visiting a sequence of points to cover an area.
example_command: Patrol the four corners of the room.
